businessDescription.tagline: Creating and maintaining habitat for wildlife
businessDescription.missionStatement: Conserving native Florida landscapes for the future by installing and maintaining wildlife habitat using exclusively native plants.
businessDescription.coreFocus: Owner-operated native plant garden maintenance studio with selective butterfly habitat installations for Venice and Sarasota area properties.
businessDescription.originStory: Sarasota-born Jaime began working with Florida native plants in 2014 while foraging for Williams Wildflowers to craft native floral arrangements for weddings and events. That hands-on experience with familiar coastal ecosystems led her to steward private gardens and eventually launch Tender Gardens as a dedicated maintenance practice serving the Venice area, formally filing the LLC on June 14, 2024.
businessDescription.businessModel: Solo practitioner intentionally limiting the schedule to four days and 20 hours per week. Focuses on long-term maintenance relationships and hand-built butterfly gardens, occasionally teaming up with trusted native experts for larger installs when they align with her lifestyle boundaries.

keyDifferentiators: Sarasota native with lifelong ties to local habitats and neighborhoods
Solo gardener delivering every visit personally with exclusively Florida native plants
Experience working with native species since 2014, beginning with Williams Wildflowers
Conservation-driven approach that invites clients into the local habitat movement
Trusted relationships with Florida Native Plants Nursery partners and long-term maintenance clients
Ongoing education to deepen native plant expertise and grassroots conservation impact

primaryService.name: Native Garden Maintenance
primaryService.description: Regular maintenance of established native plant gardens including specialized weeding (distinguishing native volunteers from invasives), seasonal cleanup, native plant health monitoring, mulch renewal, and ongoing habitat management.
primaryService.targetMarket: Homeowners with existing native gardens or recent native landscape installations
primaryService.pricingApproach: Monthly retainer or seasonal service packages

secondaryServices.name: Butterfly & Pollinator Garden Installation
secondaryServices.description: Installation of small butterfly and pollinator gardens featuring native host plants (milkweed, pipevine, passionflower) and nectar sources that bloom seasonally to support Southwest Florida pollinators.
secondaryServices.scope: Residential courtyards and compact beds, typically 100-400 sq ft
includedComponents: Native host plant installation for butterfly lifecycles
Native nectar plants for continuous bloom
secondaryServices.collaborationNote: For installations beyond this scale, Jaime may partner with fellow native plant experts, but these collaborations are limited and not part of the core offer.

serviceCapabilities.currentCapacity: Four-day, 20-hour workweek supporting 8-10 recurring maintenance clients with room for 1-2 small butterfly garden installs per month when the calendar allows
growthGoals: Maintain a stable roster of native garden maintenance accounts across Venice, Englewood, and Sarasota
Establish reputation for butterfly and pollinator garden expertise
Develop relationships with native plant nurseries for reliable sourcing
Keep collaboration installs selective so workload stays within the 20-hour boundary
limitations: Solo operation - one person handling all work
No crew hiring or employee management - Jaime prefers to work alone
No hardscaping or irrigation installation (can recommend partners)
Limited availability for large-scale installations (collaboration-only if accepted)
No tree removal or major land clearing
Service area limited to 15-mile radius from Venice, FL for efficiency

primaryAudience.demographics: Environmentally conscious homeowners in Venice/Sarasota area, typically 55-75 years old (retirees and pre-retirees), college-educated, middle to upper-middle income
psychographics: Values wildlife conservation and habitat restoration
Interested in reducing lawn maintenance and water usage (retiree-appropriate low-maintenance)
Appreciates native plant aesthetics and ecological function
Willing to invest in sustainable landscaping for retirement home
Often birders, butterfly enthusiasts, or nature lovers with time to enjoy gardens
Prefers professional maintenance over DIY (physical limitations, time priorities)
Active in Sarasota County Butterfly Club, Audubon chapters, environmental groups
painPoints: Want to support pollinators but don't know which plants to use
Concerned about invasive species taking over their yards
Need help distinguishing native plants from weeds
Looking for professional who understands native plant care
Want low-water, low-input landscape that still looks beautiful
desiredTransformations: Create a thriving backyard habitat that attracts butterflies and birds
Reduce time and money spent on lawn maintenance
Make a positive environmental impact through their landscape choices
Transform their outdoor garden into another 'room' to enjoy
Feel confident their landscape supports local ecosystems

competitivePositioning.marketPosition: Specialized boutique service focusing on native plant expertise and wildlife habitat
competitiveAdvantages: Exclusive focus on Florida natives - not a side service
Deep ecological knowledge, not just aesthetic landscaping
Long-term maintenance relationships, not one-time installations
Education-focused approach helping clients understand their gardens
competitivePositioning.pricingStrategy: Premium pricing reflecting specialized expertise, positioned 15-25% above general landscaping maintenance but competitive with other native plant specialists

coreValues: Ecological integrity - only Florida native plants
Education and stewardship - teaching clients about their landscapes
Quality over quantity - limited client base for excellent service
Long-term thinking - creating sustainable, self-supporting ecosystems
Conservation impact - every project contributes to habitat restoration
businessPhilosophy.approach: Right plant, right place. Matching native species to specific site conditions to create thriving gardens that require minimal inputs once established.
businessPhilosophy.clientRelationship: Partner with clients as stewards of their land, providing ongoing guidance and seasonal recommendations beyond just maintenance visits.

marketingMessages.primaryHeadline: Native Florida Gardens That Support Wildlife and Require Less Work
secondaryHeadlines: Sarasota Native Delivering Personal Garden Stewardship
Expert Native Plant Maintenance for Venice & Sarasota Gardens
Create Butterfly Habitat in Your Own Backyard
keyBenefits: Reduced maintenance compared to traditional lawns
Support butterflies, bees, and native birds
Lower water bills with drought-adapted natives
Professional care that understands native plant needs
Personalized service from a trusted Sarasota native who attends every visit
Guidance informed by ongoing native plant education and nursery partnerships

marketTrends: 83% of landscaping clients now request native plant species
Native plant market growing faster than general landscaping (9% vs 6.7% CAGR)
Increasing municipal mandates for native plants in Florida (30-75% requirements)
Growing consumer awareness of pollinator decline and habitat loss
Shift from high-maintenance lawns to sustainable native landscapes

typicalPricing.maintenanceMonthly: $150-400/month for residential properties depending on size and frequency
typicalPricing.butterflyGardenInstall: $800-2,200 depending on size (100-400 sq ft) and plant selections

customerJourney.awareness: Client realizes traditional landscape isn't working or wants to support wildlife
customerJourney.research: Searches for 'native plant garden maintenance' or 'butterfly garden installation near me'
customerJourney.consideration: Reviews website, social media, looks for native plant expertise and local knowledge
customerJourney.decision: Books garden walk to discuss their specific property and goals
customerJourney.onboarding: Site visit, personalized plan, phased approach if budget requires
customerJourney.loyalty: Monthly maintenance becomes long-term relationship, referrals to neighbors and friends

seasonalDemand.peak: Fall (September-November) for planting season, Spring (March-May) for maintenance refreshes and butterfly garden installs
seasonalDemand.maintenance: Year-round in Florida but lighter in summer heat, heavier in fall/winter growing season
seasonalDemand.note: Potential snowbird seasonality in Venice market - some clients may be part-time residents (Oct-Apr)

operationalRealities.supplySourcing: Partner with local native plant nurseries in Sarasota area (Florida Native Plants Nursery, Sweet Bay Nursery). Challenge: native plant availability can be limited, requires advance planning for installations. Opportunity: referral partnership with nurseries.
operationalRealities.workWeekPreferences: Operates four days per week (typically Monday-Thursday) with a 20-hour cap to protect lifestyle balance and ensure high-quality solo work.

timeAllocation.butterflyInstallation: 1-2 days for butterfly garden (100-400 sq ft)
timeAllocation.collaborationInstallation: Multi-day projects only accepted with trusted partners when scale exceeds solo capacity
